content.description: Start matched on jug left of the leaf with foot on the big shelf. Work your way around the corner to the right with feet on the lower boulder (not the very low 'helper rock' which is off) and underclings on the leaf. Climb the arete to top out.Good to have a spotter because the landing is a bit steep even though you're not high off the ground.
content.location: Just left of the Cat Pine Dyno.

content.description: Sit-start: Sitting on the roots, lay back left (uphill) with good hands; right foot on an edge and left foot jam in the crack/hole. Big reach left to the obvious edge and then work straight up for topout.
content.protection: a spotter can't do much here but maybe someone to keep you from rolling down the hill on a fall
content.location: Walk in between the Cat Pine and Leaf boulders. It's the short vertical line on the far left side of the Cat Pine boulder, starting on the left side of the mini-cave.

content.description: This is a traverse of the horizontal crack in the Cat Pine Boulder. Sit-start sitting on the big roots in the gap between the two boulders on the right side of the triangular mini-cave (see pic). Two decent edges for hands and many options for feet. Pull up into the crack, traverse right and then top out via the obvious jugs.I'm sure this was done back in the day, but as of April '21 the topout has been fully cleaned out, so it's now doable again
content.location: Starts in between the Cat Pine and Leaf boulders up the hill a bit.

content.description: Start with a sit start low and work up to small crimps.  Then explode upward dynoing to the jug.
content.location: This is the first line on this strata for rock and is right next to the tree.  There are obvious small crimps and a big gap to a jug.

content.description: Sit start with hand on the jugs and bad feet.  Work your way up the jugs and crack topping out on the slab.  Hand jams make it much easier.  There is a much harder super low start.
content.location: Walk left along the cliff from Cat Pine Dyno until you see this obvious crack about 15 feet down.

content.description: This sector has a few nice problems on sticky granite.
